intro: Chondrosum strictum, commonly known as the rigid chondrosum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in its natural habitat.
